comments.creator: matt.woodrow@gmail.com
comments.author: matt.woodrow@gmail.com
comments.text:
This test seems broken as it fails (on trunk) for me when viewed within the browser, but looks correct when run from within the reftest harness. I assume this is some snapping/rounding difference that is now changed when using floats (gfx3DMatrix).

The actual transform values on both the canvas object, and it's parent container are identical before and after the change, as are the snapped (effective) transforms.

Disabling the test for now until someone can take another look at this.
comments.raw_text:
This test seems broken as it fails (on trunk) for me when viewed within the browser, but looks correct when run from within the reftest harness. I assume this is some snapping/rounding difference that is now changed when using floats (gfx3DMatrix).

The actual transform values on both the canvas object, and it's parent container are identical before and after the change, as are the snapped (effective) transforms.

Disabling the test for now until someone can take another look at this.
